text: Monica De La Cruz (born November 11, 1974) is an American politician and businesswoman. Since 2023, she has been serving as the U.S. representative for . A member of the Republican Party, De La Cruz is also the first woman and Republican to represent the district since 1903.Herrera, Jack. Calculated move: Texas Republicans drew District 15 to fit their needs, MyRGV, November 12, 2022. == Early life and education == Monica De La Cruz was born on November 11, 1974 in Brownsville, Texas. She was raised by a single mother and she is the granddaughter of a Mexican farm worker. Monica attended the University of Texas at San Antonio, where she earned a bachelor's degree in Business Administration. After graduation, she enrolled at La Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México to study Spanish. == U.S. House of Representatives == === Elections === ==== 2020 ==== In 2020, De La Cruz ran in , and lost to incumbent Democrat Vicente Gonzalez. ==== 2022 ==== De La Cruz ran again in the 15th district in 2022, she defeated Democratic nominee Michelle Vallejo in the general election. === Caucus memberships === * Republican Main Street Partnership === Committee assignment === * Committee on Financial Services ** Subcommittee on Financial Institutions and Monetary Policy == Personal life == De La Cruz divorced from her second husband, Juan Gabriel Hernandez in 2021.
